Detailed Description

Describes the functions which the SMW Edit API should support.

Author:
Dian

PCPAny::readPage ( PCPUserCredentials $  userCredentials = NULL,
$  title = NULL,
$  revisionID = NULL 
)

Read a page from the wiki. If no revisionID given, read the latest revision. Redirects are NOT supported.

Parameters:
PCPUserCredentials $userCredentials
string $title
int $revisionID
Returns:
PCPPage

Reimplemented in PCPClient, and PCPServer.

Definition at line 284 of file Any.php.

PCPAny::updatePage ( PCPUserCredentials $  userCredentials = NULL,
$  title = NULL,
$  text = NULL,
$  summary = NULL,
$  basetimestamp = NULL,
$  md5_hash = NULL 
)

Update a page in the wiki. If the page doesn't exist, an error occurs. If the basetimestamp is not set, revision conflicts will be ignored. The md5 hash can be set to check if the text is corrupted.

Parameters:
PCPUserCredentials $userCredentials
string $title
string $text
string $summary
string $basetimestamp
string $md5_hash
Returns:
boolean

Reimplemented in PCPClient, and PCPServer.

Definition at line 301 of file Any.php.

PCPAny::updatePages ( PCPUserCredentials $  userCredentials = NULL,
$  titles = NULL,
$  texts = NULL,
$  summaries = NULL,
$  basetimestamps = NULL,
$  md5_hashes = NULL 
)

Update pages in the wiki. If a page doesn't exist, an error occurs. If the basetimestamp is not set, revision conflicts will be ignored. The md5 hash can be set to check if the text is corrupted.

Parameters:
PCPUserCredentials $userCredentials
string[] $titles
HashMap(string,string) $texts
HashMap(string,string) $summaries A hashmap with titles as keys and summaries as values.
HashMap(string,string) $basetimestamps A hashmap with titles as keys and base timestamps as values.
HashMap(string,string) $md5_hashes A hashmap with titles as keys and MD5 hashes as values.
Returns:
boolean

Reimplemented in PCPServer.
